feature.name: daily wage calculator
feature.description: Operationally, "daily wage calculator" is used to compute daily-rate based salary amounts (e.g., deductions, proration, or settlement-related calculations) based on configuration and payroll/leave context. Ticket evidence repeatedly connects this behaviour to unpaid leave deductions and leave-related payroll adjustments. Evidence indicates calculations may use either calendar days or working days (with weekends/holidays considerations) depending on configuration and scenario. Tickets highlight configuration precedence where global payroll settings can override policy-level settings, creating unexpected outcomes for users. Tickets also report UI/display mismatches (e.g., remarks showing different day counts) even when backend calculations are otherwise consistent. Several tickets suggest recalculation/synchronization gaps where changes (salary config, holidays, deleted requests) do not retroactively update already-generated results. Customer requests frequently ask for greater configurability, clearer transparency, and control over calculation bases and divisors.

known_issues.title: Payroll Settings Override Leave Policy Daily Wage Formula
known_issues.issue_explanation: The daily wage calculator in payroll settings intentionally overrides the formula configured in leave policy for unpaid leave. The leave policy formula appears greyed out, indicating it is not active. This creates user confusion about which formula is actually being applied for daily wage calculations.
known_issues.limitation_statement: The platform lacks clear visual communication about formula override mechanisms. Users cannot easily understand why formulas are greyed out or how payroll settings supersede leave policy configurations.
known_issues.gap_statement: There is no synchronized mechanism for daily wage formula configuration between leave policy and payroll modules. The system requires manual alignment and does not provide automatic formula inheritance or synchronization.

known_issues.title: Unpaid Leave Deduction Calculation
known_issues.issue_explanation: System failed to recalculate pending unpaid leave deductions when new salary configurations were created after leave request submission. Deductions were incorrectly based on previous salary configuration instead of current one, resulting in payroll calculation discrepancies.
known_issues.gap_statement: Product gap in dynamic salary configuration handling, specifically in automatically updating pending leave deductions when salary configurations change. | Lack of transparent explanation for complex payroll calculation methods

known_issues.title: End of Service Gratuity Calculation Incorrect for Leap Years
known_issues.issue_explanation: The system incorrectly calculates service days by using 365 days instead of 366 days for 2024, resulting in an inaccurate gratuity amount. When calculating End of Service (EOS) gratuity, the system fails to recognize 2024 as a leap year, causing a calculation discrepancy of approximately AED 17.26.
known_issues.limitation_statement: Gratuity calculation logic does not automatically adjust for leap years, leading to potential underpayment of employee benefits.
known_issues.gap_statement: The EOS gratuity calculator requires enhancement to dynamically handle leap year calculations and automatically recognize 366-day years in service period computations.

known_issues.title: Incorrect Pro-Rated End of Service Amount Calculation
known_issues.issue_explanation: End of Service (EOS) calculation is producing incorrect pro-rated amounts due to a rounding or decimal precision error. The daily wage formula (basic + allowances / 30) is configured correctly, but when calculating pro-rated EOS amounts, the system consistently shows amounts that are less than expected by 0.1 or 0.2 decimals.
known_issues.limitation_statement: The platform's daily wage calculation engine has a decimal precision limitation that causes systematic undercalculation of pro-rated amounts.
known_issues.gap_statement: There is a potential product gap in the precision of financial calculations, specifically in pro-rated salary computations.

known_issues.title: Gratuity Calculation Complexity
known_issues.issue_explanation: The daily wage calculator's gratuity calculation involves complex logic for handling partial years of service, especially for periods above 5 years. The system uses different calculation approaches for complete and incomplete years, including specific handling for leap years by using 366 as a divisor when appropriate.
known_issues.gap_statement: Potential lack of transparent calculation method for prorating gratuity in partial years | Need for more detailed, user-friendly explanation of gratuity calculation logic, including worked examples of service duration calculation for partial years and leap year handling.

known_issues.title: Gratuity Calculation Not Considering Leap Year Day
known_issues.issue_explanation: System may not consistently account for February 29th when calculating service duration for gratuity, potentially causing minor discrepancies in total days worked (912 vs 913 days)
known_issues.limitation_statement: Leap year day inclusion in service duration calculation is not transparently handled
known_issues.gap_statement: Need clear documentation on how leap year days are precisely counted in service duration calculations

known_issues.title: Inconsistent Days Worked Calculation in Gratuity
known_issues.issue_explanation: Platform calculates days worked with a potential extra day (622 vs 623 days), causing slight variations in gratuity calculation. The system uses a fixed divisor of 30 days for daily wage, which may not align with all client calculation preferences.
known_issues.limitation_statement: Days worked calculation shows minor inconsistency in total days counted
known_issues.gap_statement: Potential precision issue in days worked calculation method

known_issues.title: Leave Salary Calculation Discrepancy
known_issues.issue_explanation: System calculates leave salary based on predefined policy configuration, which may not align with user expectations about calendar days. The daily wage is divided by a configured number of days (30 vs 31), potentially causing salary calculation differences.
known_issues.limitation_statement: Leave salary calculation is rigidly tied to predefined policy configurations that may not flexibly adapt to varying month lengths or specific employee scenarios.
known_issues.gap_statement: Lack of transparent explanation about how leave salary calculations are performed, including clear documentation about daily rate divisor configurations and policy-driven calculations.

known_issues.title: Leave Salary Accrual Calculation Inconsistency
known_issues.issue_explanation: The daily wage calculator's 'working days' setting causes monthly fluctuations in leave salary accrual calculations. The daily wage rate changes based on the number of working days in each month, leading to inconsistent cumulative totals.
known_issues.limitation_statement: Monthly leave salary accruals vary due to changing working days per month
known_issues.gap_statement: The platform lacks a straightforward way to maintain consistent daily wage calculations across months

known_issues.title: Leave Salary Calculation Inconsistency
known_issues.issue_explanation: The system calculates leave salary and salary proration using different daily wage divisors (30 vs 30.42 days), causing calculation discrepancies. Leave salary uses a 30-day divisor while salary proration uses 30.42 days, leading to different prorated amounts.
known_issues.limitation_statement: Leave salary and salary proration daily wage calculations are configured independently with different divisors.
known_issues.gap_statement: No unified daily wage calculation method across leave salary and salary proration scenarios

known_issues.title: Proration Calculation Confusion
known_issues.issue_explanation: User initially misunderstood how working days are calculated based on work week configuration. The system was calculating correctly, but the user did not initially understand that their specific work week (NVK Operations) had all 7 days configured as working days.
known_issues.limitation_statement: Salary proration depends entirely on work week configuration, which may not match traditional calendar day expectations

known_issues.title: Incorrect Salary Proration for Offboarded Employees
known_issues.issue_explanation: The system fails to correctly prorate salaries when an employee's departure date is in the future relative to payroll processing date. When an employee is offboarded (e.g., on Nov 28th) and payroll is processed earlier (e.g., Nov 27th), the system displays the full monthly salary instead of a prorated amount.
known_issues.limitation_statement: Payroll system lacks robust date-sensitive proration logic for employees with future departure dates
known_issues.gap_statement: Calculation logic does not handle dynamic proration scenarios for employees with departure dates differing from payroll processing date

known_issues.title: Duplicate Payroll Deductions After Leave Recalculation
known_issues.issue_explanation: When an unpaid leave request is approved and transaction submitted, then the daily wage calculation is changed and the transaction deleted to recalculate, the system creates duplicate deductions—one with the old calculation and one with the new. Moving the leave request back to pending/accepted does not resolve the issue. Even after deleting the unpaid leave request entirely, the unpaid leave deduction persists in payroll deductions.
known_issues.limitation_statement: The platform lacks robust synchronization logic between leave management and payroll deduction systems. When leave transactions are modified or deleted, the payroll deduction module does not automatically reconcile or remove associated deductions.
known_issues.gap_statement: Clear product gap in leave-to-payroll transaction management, specifically around handling recalculations, deletions, and status changes of leave requests without creating orphaned or duplicate deductions.

known_issues.title: Unpaid Leave Deduction Calculation Mismatch
known_issues.issue_explanation: When public holidays are added after a leave request is created, the daily wage calculation becomes inconsistent between Payroll and Time Off modules. This causes incorrect salary deduction amounts that cannot be retroactively corrected.
known_issues.limitation_statement: The system lacks real-time synchronization between Time Off and Payroll modules when public holidays are configured after leave requests.
known_issues.gap_statement: Need for enhanced module communication to ensure accurate working days calculation and consistent salary deduction across system configurations.

known_issues.title: Incorrect Days Displayed in Unpaid Leave Remarks
known_issues.issue_explanation: The platform displays incorrect remarks for daily wage calculations in February, showing 31 days instead of the actual 29 days for leap years. The backend calculation remains accurate, but the frontend display creates potential user confusion.
known_issues.limitation_statement: The platform currently displays incorrect remarks for daily wage calculations in February, showing 31 days instead of the actual 29 days for leap years. While the backend calculation remains accurate, the frontend display creates potential user confusion.
known_issues.gap_statement: There is a need for a dynamic calendar days detection mechanism that automatically adjusts daily rate calculations and remarks based on the actual number of days in each month, especially for edge cases like February in leap years.

known_issues.title: Global Daily Rate Configuration Overrides Policy Settings
known_issues.issue_explanation: The system applies a global daily rate configuration that overrides individual leave policy settings for unpaid leave calculations. This means the daily wage is calculated using a system-wide setting instead of policy-specific methods, potentially leading to incorrect salary deductions.
known_issues.limitation_statement: Global daily rate settings automatically override policy-specific unpaid leave calculation methods
known_issues.gap_statement: Lack of transparency in configuration hierarchy and limited user controls for customizing leave deduction calculations across different work schedules

known_issues.title: Incorrect Daily Rate Month Display
known_issues.issue_explanation: The system shows the daily rate from the payroll month (May) instead of the leave occurrence month (April), causing user confusion. The actual deduction amount is calculated correctly, but the displayed daily rate does not match the month when leave occurred.
known_issues.limitation_statement: Daily rate display logic does not preserve the initially calculated rate from the leave occurrence month
known_issues.gap_statement: Need for a consistent daily rate display mechanism that stores and shows the rate from the original leave request time

limitations.title: Lack of Automated Salary Proration
limitations.limitation_statement: The current Bayzat payroll system lacks automated salary calculation based on precise working days. The platform cannot dynamically adjust salaries proportionally when employees work more or fewer than the standard 26 working days.
limitations.impact: Requires manual tracking of overtime, unpaid leaves, and does not support automatic pro-rata salary adjustments per employee

limitations.title: Payroll Settings Take Precedence Over Leave Policy
limitations.limitation_statement: Payroll daily wage calculator configuration overrides leave policy formula for unpaid leave calculations. The leave policy formula becomes inactive and is displayed as greyed out.
limitations.impact: Users must configure daily wage calculation in payroll settings to determine the actual formula used for unpaid leave deductions

limitations.title: Salary Config Change Impact on Leave Deductions
limitations.limitation_statement: Unpaid leave deductions may not automatically update if salary configuration changes after leave request creation
limitations.impact: Potential payroll calculation inaccuracies

limitations.title: Incorrect Handling of Leap Year Days in Service Period
limitations.limitation_statement: The system defaults to 365 days per year, failing to correctly account for leap years when calculating total service days for gratuity computation.
limitations.impact: Potential underpayment of employee end of service benefits due to incorrect day counting

limitations.title: Decimal Precision Limitation in Pro-Rated Calculations
limitations.limitation_statement: Pro-rated amounts are calculated using (basic + allowances / 30), but suffer from decimal precision errors that consistently underreport amounts.
limitations.impact: Employees may receive slightly less than their expected pro-rated end of service amount

limitations.title: Mid-Month Departure Leave Accrual Limitation
limitations.limitation_statement: Leave days are accrued at end of month, preventing inclusion of partial month leave in End of Service (EOS) calculations
limitations.impact: Employees departing mid-month cannot automatically include that month's leave balance

limitations.title: Service Duration Calculation Ambiguity
limitations.limitation_statement: Unclear methodology for counting service days, including departure date and leap year days
limitations.impact: Potential minor discrepancies in gratuity amount calculation

limitations.title: Complex Service Duration Calculation
limitations.limitation_statement: The system calculates service duration with nuanced rules, including different approaches for years before and after 5 years of service, and specific handling of partial years.
limitations.impact: Potential user confusion about precise gratuity calculation methodology

limitations.title: Fixed Daily Wage Divisor Limitation
limitations.limitation_statement: Daily wage is calculated using a hardcoded divisor of 30 days (Basic/30), which cannot be modified or configured to alternative formulas like (Basic × 12/365)
limitations.impact: Prevents customization of gratuity calculation methodology for different organizational requirements

limitations.title: Inflexible Daily Wage Calculation
limitations.limitation_statement: The platform cannot override the standard leave salary calculation method based on policy configurations. Users are bound by the predefined divisor settings for daily wage calculations.
limitations.impact: Users cannot easily modify the calculation method to account for specific month lengths or unique employee scenarios.

limitations.title: Leave Encashment Daily Wage Calculation Method
limitations.limitation_statement: Leave salary accrual is calculated based on working days, which varies month to month
limitations.impact: Cumulative leave salary amounts can differ between months due to varying working day counts

limitations.title: Separate Daily Wage Calculation Methods
limitations.limitation_statement: The platform calculates leave salary and salary proration using separate configurations that cannot be automatically aligned without manual intervention.
limitations.impact: Potential calculation discrepancies between leave salary and salary proration

limitations.title: Proration Based on Work Week Configuration
limitations.limitation_statement: Salary proration is calculated based on the specific work week configuration, which may include all 7 days as working days
limitations.impact: Proration may differ from traditional calendar day calculations depending on work week setup

limitations.title: Inconsistent Salary Proration Based on Departure Date
limitations.limitation_statement: Salary proration only works correctly when departure date is in the past, not when it's in the future
limitations.impact: Potential incorrect salary calculations for employees with future offboarding dates

limitations.title: Unreliable Leave Transaction Deduction Management
limitations.limitation_statement: Leave management system does not reliably sync deduction changes with payroll module when leave transactions are modified, deleted, or status is changed.
limitations.impact: Users cannot reliably recalculate unpaid leave deductions without generating duplicate or persistent incorrect payroll entries

limitations.title: Daily Wage Calculation Method
limitations.limitation_statement: Daily wage is calculated as: (basic salary + allowance) / working days, where working days exclude weekends and public holidays
limitations.impact: Affects unpaid leave deduction accuracy when public holidays or working days configuration changes

limitations.title: Lack of Real-Time Module Communication
limitations.limitation_statement: Time Off module cannot send complete leave request details to Payroll module in real-time, causing calculation inconsistencies
limitations.impact: Prevents automatic recalculation of salary deductions when configuration changes occur

limitations.title: Fixed 30.42 Days Divisor for Wage Calculations
limitations.limitation_statement: System uses a fixed 30.42 days divisor for daily wage calculations, which may not align with calendar months
limitations.impact: Deduction amounts may slightly exceed expected monthly salary

limitations.title: February Days Calculation in Leap Years
limitations.limitation_statement: The system may default to 31 days when calculating daily rates for February, instead of using the correct 29 days in leap years.
limitations.impact: Potential inaccurate display of daily rates in remarks, though actual calculations remain correct

limitations.title: Global Settings Override Policy-Level Calculations
limitations.limitation_statement: The platform has a global configuration that supersedes individual policy-level settings for unpaid leave calculations
limitations.impact: Users cannot customize leave deduction calculations at the policy level when a global setting exists

limitations.title: Daily Rate Calculation Method
limitations.limitation_statement: Daily rate is calculated as (Basic + Allowances) / Working Days, excluding public holidays
limitations.impact: Affects unpaid leave deduction calculations across different months

troubleshooting_notes.symptom: Unable to automatically adjust salary based on actual working days
troubleshooting_notes.likely_cause_or_explanation: Current payroll system lacks automated proration capabilities
troubleshooting_notes.workaround_or_resolution: Use a mix of unpaid leaves and overtime tracking, managed separately for each employee

troubleshooting_notes.symptom: Inconsistent daily wage formula display between leave policy and payroll settings
troubleshooting_notes.likely_cause_or_explanation: Payroll settings are designed to override leave policy formula for unpaid leave calculations
troubleshooting_notes.workaround_or_resolution: Configure daily wage calculator in payroll settings first; verify the formula matches intended calculation method

troubleshooting_notes.likely_cause_or_explanation: Deduction calculated based on outdated salary configuration
troubleshooting_notes.workaround_or_resolution: Delete the existing leave request and recreate it if deduction has not been processed yet

troubleshooting_notes.symptom: Discrepancy in End of Service Gratuity Calculation
troubleshooting_notes.likely_cause_or_explanation: System uses a fixed 365-day year calculation, failing to recognize leap years
troubleshooting_notes.workaround_or_resolution: Manually adjust calculation to use 366 days for leap years when computing service period and gratuity

troubleshooting_notes.symptom: End of Service calculation shows amounts less than expected (e.g., 89,999.9 instead of 9000)
troubleshooting_notes.likely_cause_or_explanation: Decimal precision error in daily wage calculation formula (basic + allowances / 30)
troubleshooting_notes.workaround_or_resolution: Development team has been escalated and the issue was reportedly resolved. Users should verify calculations after the fix.

troubleshooting_notes.symptom: Discrepancy between system and manual gratuity calculations
troubleshooting_notes.likely_cause_or_explanation: Calculation involves splitting service duration into different rate periods (21 days/year for first 5 years, 30 days/year after)
troubleshooting_notes.workaround_or_resolution: Manually verify calculation by: 1) Calculate daily wage (total salary/30), 2) Apply tiered rates based on service duration, 3) Prorate partial years by days/365

troubleshooting_notes.symptom: Mismatch between manual and system gratuity calculations
troubleshooting_notes.likely_cause_or_explanation: Different methodologies for calculating service duration, especially for periods above 5 years and handling of partial years
troubleshooting_notes.workaround_or_resolution: Understand system's specific calculation logic, including use of 366 days for leap years and pro-rata calculation for incomplete years

troubleshooting_notes.likely_cause_or_explanation: Salary calculated based on fixed policy configuration rather than actual calendar days
troubleshooting_notes.workaround_or_resolution: Verify daily rate configuration in leave policy settings; understand that system follows policy rules for calculation

troubleshooting_notes.symptom: Unexpected variations in leave salary accrual amounts across months
troubleshooting_notes.likely_cause_or_explanation: Daily wage calculator set to 'working days' method, causing calculation variations
troubleshooting_notes.workaround_or_resolution: Consider using 'custom days' setting for more consistent leave encashment calculations

troubleshooting_notes.likely_cause_or_explanation: Different divisors used for leave salary (30 days) and salary proration (30.42 days)
troubleshooting_notes.workaround_or_resolution: Manually align daily wage configurations or verify specific calculation method with payroll team

troubleshooting_notes.likely_cause_or_explanation: Check work week configuration to understand how working days are defined
troubleshooting_notes.workaround_or_resolution: Verify employee's work week setup to confirm expected proration calculation

troubleshooting_notes.symptom: Full monthly salary displayed for offboarded employees

troubleshooting_notes.workaround_or_resolution: Manually calculate prorated salary based on daily rate (total monthly salary / 30 * days worked)

claims_to_validate.title: End of Service Gratuity Calculation Incorrect for Leap Years
claims_to_validate.statement: The system incorrectly calculates service days by using 365 days instead of 366 days for 2024, resulting in an inaccurate gratuity amount. When calculating End of Service (EOS) gratuity, the system fails to recognize 2024 as a leap year, causing a calculation discrepancy of approximately AED 17.26.

claims_to_validate.title: Incorrect Pro-Rated End of Service Amount Calculation
claims_to_validate.statement: End of Service (EOS) calculation is producing incorrect pro-rated amounts due to a rounding or decimal precision error. The daily wage formula (basic + allowances / 30) is configured correctly, but when calculating pro-rated EOS amounts, the system consistently shows amounts that are less than expected by 0.1 or 0.2 decimals.

claims_to_validate.title: Gratuity Calculation Complexity
claims_to_validate.statement: The daily wage calculator's gratuity calculation involves complex logic for handling partial years of service, especially for periods above 5 years. The system uses different calculation approaches for complete and incomplete years, including specific handling for leap years by using 366 as a divisor when appropriate.

claims_to_validate.title: Gratuity Calculation Not Considering Leap Year Day
claims_to_validate.statement: System may not consistently account for February 29th when calculating service duration for gratuity, potentially causing minor discrepancies in total days worked (912 vs 913 days)

claims_to_validate.title: Inconsistent Days Worked Calculation in Gratuity
claims_to_validate.statement: Platform calculates days worked with a potential extra day (622 vs 623 days), causing slight variations in gratuity calculation. The system uses a fixed divisor of 30 days for daily wage, which may not align with all client calculation preferences.

claims_to_validate.title: Leave Salary Calculation Discrepancy
claims_to_validate.statement: System calculates leave salary based on predefined policy configuration, which may not align with user expectations about calendar days. The daily wage is divided by a configured number of days (30 vs 31), potentially causing salary calculation differences.

claims_to_validate.title: Leave Salary Accrual Calculation Inconsistency
claims_to_validate.statement: The daily wage calculator's 'working days' setting causes monthly fluctuations in leave salary accrual calculations. The daily wage rate changes based on the number of working days in each month, leading to inconsistent cumulative totals.

claims_to_validate.title: Leave Salary Calculation Inconsistency
claims_to_validate.statement: The system calculates leave salary and salary proration using different daily wage divisors (30 vs 30.42 days), causing calculation discrepancies. Leave salary uses a 30-day divisor while salary proration uses 30.42 days, leading to different prorated amounts.

claims_to_validate.title: Proration Calculation Confusion
claims_to_validate.statement: User initially misunderstood how working days are calculated based on work week configuration. The system was calculating correctly, but the user did not initially understand that their specific work week (NVK Operations) had all 7 days configured as working days.

claims_to_validate.title: Incorrect Salary Proration for Offboarded Employees
claims_to_validate.statement: The system fails to correctly prorate salaries when an employee's departure date is in the future relative to payroll processing date. When an employee is offboarded (e.g., on Nov 28th) and payroll is processed earlier (e.g., Nov 27th), the system displays the full monthly salary instead of a prorated amount.

claims_to_validate.title: Duplicate Payroll Deductions After Leave Recalculation
claims_to_validate.statement: When an unpaid leave request is approved and transaction submitted, then the daily wage calculation is changed and the transaction deleted to recalculate, the system creates duplicate deductions—one with the old calculation and one with the new. Moving the leave request back to pending/accepted does not resolve the issue. Even after deleting the unpaid leave request entirely, the unpaid leave deduction persists in payroll deductions.

claims_to_validate.title: Unpaid Leave Deduction Calculation Mismatch
claims_to_validate.statement: When public holidays are added after a leave request is created, the daily wage calculation becomes inconsistent between Payroll and Time Off modules. This causes incorrect salary deduction amounts that cannot be retroactively corrected.

claims_to_validate.title: Incorrect Days Displayed in Unpaid Leave Remarks
claims_to_validate.statement: The platform currently displays incorrect remarks for daily wage calculations in February, showing 31 days instead of the actual 29 days for leap years. While the backend calculation remains accurate, the frontend display creates potential user confusion.

claims_to_validate.title: Global Daily Rate Configuration Overrides Policy Settings
claims_to_validate.statement: The system applies a global daily rate configuration that overrides individual leave policy settings for unpaid leave calculations. This means the daily wage is calculated using a system-wide setting instead of policy-specific methods, potentially leading to incorrect salary deductions.

claims_to_validate.title: Incorrect Daily Rate Month Display
claims_to_validate.statement: The system shows the daily rate from the payroll month (May) instead of the leave occurrence month (April), causing user confusion. The actual deduction amount is calculated correctly, but the displayed daily rate does not match the month when leave occurred.

claims_to_validate.title: Lack of Automated Salary Proration
claims_to_validate.statement: The current Bayzat payroll system lacks automated salary calculation based on precise working days. The platform cannot dynamically adjust salaries proportionally when employees work more or fewer than the standard 26 working days.

claims_to_validate.title: Payroll Settings Take Precedence Over Leave Policy
claims_to_validate.statement: Payroll daily wage calculator configuration overrides leave policy formula for unpaid leave calculations. The leave policy formula becomes inactive and is displayed as greyed out.

claims_to_validate.title: Salary Config Change Impact on Leave Deductions
claims_to_validate.statement: Unpaid leave deductions may not automatically update if salary configuration changes after leave request creation

claims_to_validate.title: Incorrect Handling of Leap Year Days in Service Period
claims_to_validate.statement: The system defaults to 365 days per year, failing to correctly account for leap years when calculating total service days for gratuity computation.

claims_to_validate.title: Decimal Precision Limitation in Pro-Rated Calculations
claims_to_validate.statement: Pro-rated amounts are calculated using (basic + allowances / 30), but suffer from decimal precision errors that consistently underreport amounts.

claims_to_validate.title: Mid-Month Departure Leave Accrual Limitation
claims_to_validate.statement: Leave days are accrued at end of month, preventing inclusion of partial month leave in End of Service (EOS) calculations

claims_to_validate.title: Service Duration Calculation Ambiguity
claims_to_validate.statement: Unclear methodology for counting service days, including departure date and leap year days

claims_to_validate.title: Complex Service Duration Calculation
claims_to_validate.statement: The system calculates service duration with nuanced rules, including different approaches for years before and after 5 years of service, and specific handling of partial years.

claims_to_validate.title: Fixed Daily Wage Divisor Limitation
claims_to_validate.statement: Daily wage is calculated using a hardcoded divisor of 30 days (Basic/30), which cannot be modified or configured to alternative formulas like (Basic × 12/365)

claims_to_validate.title: Inflexible Daily Wage Calculation
claims_to_validate.statement: The platform cannot override the standard leave salary calculation method based on policy configurations. Users are bound by the predefined divisor settings for daily wage calculations.

claims_to_validate.title: Leave Encashment Daily Wage Calculation Method
claims_to_validate.statement: Leave salary accrual is calculated based on working days, which varies month to month

claims_to_validate.title: Separate Daily Wage Calculation Methods
claims_to_validate.statement: The platform calculates leave salary and salary proration using separate configurations that cannot be automatically aligned without manual intervention.

claims_to_validate.title: Proration Based on Work Week Configuration
claims_to_validate.statement: Salary proration is calculated based on the specific work week configuration, which may include all 7 days as working days

claims_to_validate.title: Inconsistent Salary Proration Based on Departure Date
claims_to_validate.statement: Salary proration only works correctly when departure date is in the past, not when it's in the future

claims_to_validate.title: Unreliable Leave Transaction Deduction Management
claims_to_validate.statement: Leave management system does not reliably sync deduction changes with payroll module when leave transactions are modified, deleted, or status is changed.

claims_to_validate.title: Daily Wage Calculation Method
claims_to_validate.statement: Daily wage is calculated as: (basic salary + allowance) / working days, where working days exclude weekends and public holidays

claims_to_validate.title: Lack of Real-Time Module Communication
claims_to_validate.statement: Time Off module cannot send complete leave request details to Payroll module in real-time, causing calculation inconsistencies

claims_to_validate.title: February Days Calculation in Leap Years
claims_to_validate.statement: The system may default to 31 days when calculating daily rates for February, instead of using the correct 29 days in leap years.

claims_to_validate.title: Global Settings Override Policy-Level Calculations
claims_to_validate.statement: The platform has a global configuration that supersedes individual policy-level settings for unpaid leave calculations

claims_to_validate.title: Daily Rate Calculation Method
claims_to_validate.statement: Daily rate is calculated as (Basic + Allowances) / Working Days, excluding public holidays
